examples: The company's ex-CEO was known for his aggressive management style.
The normally reserved and polite man became aggressive and confrontational when he was drunk, revealing a darker side of his personality.
The two lawyers were both known for their aggressive tactics, so when they faced each other in court, it was a case of when Greek meets Greek, then comes the tug of war.
The squirrels got aggressive, a hallmark of frustration.
Windows updates are notoriously aggressive.
words.defineEn: behaving in an angry way and having a tendency to be violent
words.defineVi: cư xử một cách tức giận và có xu hướng bạo lực

examples: Of what?' asked the astonished father.
'Here?' repeated Bounderby, more astonished than ever.
words.defineEn: feeling very surprised or impressed, especially because of an unexpected event
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất ngạc nhiên hoặc ấn tượng, đặc biệt là vì một sự kiện bất ngờ

examples: It's going to be awkward, to say the least.
This is awkward.
This is awkward.
that was awkward.
This is awkward.
words.defineEn: making one feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
words.defineVi: làm cho một người cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc không thoải mái

examples: The pith of the citrus fruit added a bitter taste to the juice.
Bitter orange peel is a great addition to my herbal remedies.
Losing to a younger player was a bitter pill to swallow.
She grimaced at the taste of the bitter medicine.
Sarah and her ex-husband had a bitter divorce, and there is no love lost between them.
words.defineEn: (of a person) refusing or unable to let go of anger or resentment toward others or past events
words.defineVi: (của một người) từ chối hoặc không thể buông bỏ sự tức giận hoặc oán giận đối với người khác hoặc các sự kiện trong quá khứ

examples: Asian landscapes range from breathtaking mountains to stunning beaches.
The west is known for its stunning landscapes and breathtaking sunsets.
We hiked up the mountain and enjoyed the breathtaking view from the top.
We critics variously declared the show brilliant, the cat's pyjamas, breathtaking, and unmissable.
The breathtaking view from the mountaintop is the crowning glory of the hiking trail, rewarding the hikers' efforts.
words.defineEn: arousing great excitement, surprise, or admiration in someone
words.defineVi: khơi dậy sự phấn khích, ngạc nhiên hoặc ngưỡng mộ ở ai đó

words.defineEn: describing something that is cold and depressing
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó là lạnh và buồn

examples: They visited a local herb garden and were delighted to discover a thriving patch of clary sage.
Delighted, I gave him some skin, and his mother gave him a big hug.
Midas was delighted.
I was delighted to see my old friend Bessie again.
I am delighted with the house I am renting from him.
words.defineEn: very happy or pleased
words.defineVi: rất hạnh phúc hoặc hài lòng

examples: This is incredibly depressing.
But it becomes even more depressing.
It’s an incredibly depressing place.
Oh, that's a depressing distress call.
When I turned six years old, it was a very depressing time in my life.
words.defineEn: making one feel sad
words.defineVi: làm người ta buồn

examples: Scorpion was disgusting rehearsal.
That's disgusting.
This is disgusting.
- That's disgusting.
- It looks disgusting.
words.defineEn: describing something that is very unpleasant
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó là rất khó chịu

examples: The children scarfed down the pizza at the birthday party.
Turn the mould upside down.
His parents are always breathing down his neck.
That song always sends a shiver down my spine.
A path led down the hill.
words.defineEn: feeling unhappy or dejected
words.defineVi: cảm thấy không vui hoặc chán nản

examples: Her voice broke as she told us the dreadful news.
The scales have finally fallen from his eyes and he realises that he's made a dreadful mistake.
But the measles virus uses a dreadful tactic.
This is a dreadful mistake.
This is a dreadful mistake.
words.defineEn: very bad
words.defineVi: rất tệ

examples: The film was as dull as ditchwater.
Frankly, this book sounded dull as ditchwater to me.
The book was pretty dull and didn't really stand out from other similar books in the genre.
Much of the book was very dull.
They found an overripe watermelon in their garden, its rind was dull and the flesh was overly soft and sweet.
words.defineEn: lacking in distinguishing or exceptional qualities, often suggesting a lack of originality, creativity, or character
words.defineVi: thiếu phẩm chất khác biệt hoặc đặc biệt, thường cho thấy sự thiếu độc đáo, sáng tạo hoặc tính cách

examples: The film had a surprisingly emotional ending, leaving the audience in tears.
The issue is highly emotional and will cause a lot of blood on the carpet.
Sarah went through a lot of emotional turmoil after her breakup with Mark.
The film incorporated abstract imagery and surreal elements to convey the protagonist's inner emotional journey.
The orchestra's rendition of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony was of the first water, with precise execution and a powerful emotional impact that left the audience in awe.
words.defineEn: showing great emotions or feelings
words.defineVi: thể hiện cảm xúc hoặc cảm xúc tuyệt vời

examples: The house has sat empty for two years.
Our waiter cleared the empty plates from the table.
I got an empty gift box.
He emptied the full trash can into the larger dumpster outside.
I placed my bag on the empty chair next to me.
words.defineEn: unhappy and without any purpose
words.defineVi: không hạnh phúc và không có mục đích

examples: I'm always fascinated.
I am just fascinated by fluid dynamics, ballistics, optics, mechanics, aerodynamics.
I'm absolutely fascinated with your work.
In the early 1800s, he became fascinated with human digestion especially our urine.
And I'm fascinated with that stuff.
words.defineEn: having a strong interest and curiosity in something
words.defineVi: có một sự quan tâm mạnh mẽ và sự tò mò trong một cái gì đó

examples: After a long and exhausting day at work, Mark returned home looking like death warmed over.
It sounds exhausting.
It's exhausting.
"That sounds exhausting."
It's exhausting.
words.defineEn: causing one to feel very tired and out of energy
words.defineVi: khiến một người cảm thấy rất mệt mỏi và hết năng lượng

examples: European monarchs and clergy were fearful of similar revolts on their home soil.
People were very fearful during the crisis that people wouldn't cruise again.
I am fearful day in and day out.
And people are more fearful because they really think they don't have a chance.
I sense that you are a little bit fearful.
words.defineEn: showing fear or being afraid
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự sợ hãi hoặc sợ hãi

examples: I’m fed up with you two talking shop.
Farmers are angry and fed up to the back teeth of empty promises from politicians.
I'm already fed up with your lazy, selfish behavior, Jim, but if you can't be bothered to come with me to my own mother's funeral, that will be the straw that breaks the donkey's back!
He was pretty much fed up and had been kind of at the end of his rope.
I know that we're all kind of fed up with this and we want this to be over.
words.defineEn: feeling annoyed, upset, bored with something happening for a long time
words.defineVi: cảm thấy khó chịu, khó chịu, buồn chán với một điều gì đó xảy ra trong một thời gian dài

examples: I was furious that he went over my head and complained to my manager.
I was furious but just left it at that since he obviously didn't care about me.
I was furious, so I went for a run to get it out of my system.
The families were furious.
The stranger was furious.
words.defineEn: feeling great anger
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất tức giận

examples: You're homesick?
His mother told me that he was never homesick.
In 1945, a Japanese chef began using the cooking style to grill steaks for homesick American soldiers.

While there is a 1,000 year history of celebrating the holiday with food and drink, the first St. Patrick’s Day parade actually occurred on American soil on March 17, 1772 when homesick Irish soldiers serving British forces marched in New York City in honor of the saint.
words.defineEn: feeling sad because of being away from one's home
words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn vì xa nhà của một người

examples: The skin gets irritated.
Number three, you're easily irritated.
Or, they just feel really irritated with anything and everything.
My throat is so, irritated that I'm just hoping it doesn't seal up.
Or an irritated family member says, "It's right there, you just didn't look."
words.defineEn: feeling angry or annoyed
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tức giận hoặc khó chịu

examples: Make a complaint if you are not satisfied with the service.
The school's dedication to providing quality education and fostering a supportive learning environment was showcased in a good light by satisfied parents.
Maria's boss was never satisfied with her work, and she realized that desire has no limit, as no matter how much she improved, he always wanted more.
Jack never felt satisfied devoting his time and attention to one thing, so instead he's scratched the surface of a number of hobbies and interests.
I'm satisfied.
words.defineEn: feeling happy because we have what we wanted, or because something has happened the way we wanted
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc vì chúng tôi có những gì chúng tôi muốn, hoặc vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra theo cách chúng tôi muốn

examples: As the story of the haunted house was passed down from generation to generation, it became more terrifying with each telling.
At its most terrifying, his writing sends shivers up and down my spine.
Conversations with new people can be sort of terrifying.
- That's terrifying.
It's terrifying.
words.defineEn: causing a person to become filled with fear
words.defineVi: khiến một người trở nên đầy sợ hãi

examples: As Jessica watched her son's new girlfriend interact with their family, she couldn't help but feel a bit uncomfortable, considering that the girl appeared to be old enough to be his mother.
After walking all day in uncomfortable shoes, Jane exclaimed, "My dogs are barking!"
Eating a big meal right before bed doesn't sit right with me - I always end up feeling bloated and uncomfortable.
Real eyes realise, and it's time for us to start confronting the uncomfortable truths about our society.
That chair looks super uncomfortable.
words.defineEn: describing something that makes one feel embarrassed or anxious
words.defineVi: mô tả một cái gì đó mà làm cho một người cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc lo lắng

examples: The ocean's blue color amazed us.
Which just amazes people.
It amazes me that there's so much focus on Kansas.
In the Olympic Games, Fosbury amazed the world with his new technique, winning a gold metal with an Olympic record leap of 2.24 meters.
And it literally amazes me they don't understand that.
words.defineEn: to greatly surprise someone
words.defineVi: để rất ngạc nhiên ai đó

examples: My only regret is that he didn't turn up at court to watch his Pyrrhic victory.
She made a bad choice and regretted it later.
She received an ugly haircut that she immediately regretted.
He regretted consuming a large portion of fast food, realizing later that it was loaded with trans fatty acids.
Jane regretted her decision to kiss and tell about her night with Tom, as the rumors spread quickly and ruined her reputation.
words.defineEn: to feel disappointed or sorry about something that has or has not been done, etc.
words.defineVi: cảm thấy thất vọng hoặc tiếc nuối về điều gì đó đã hoặc chưa được thực hiện, v.v.

examples: She looked away from embarrassment.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
In that embarrassment of riches, some people might wonder whether we need another service area at all.
Julia's fiancé left her at the altar, causing her immense heartbreak and embarrassment.
The committee is being accused of sweeping financial problems under the carpet to avoid embarrassment.
words.defineEn: a feeling of distress, shyness or guilt as a result of an uncomfortable situation
words.defineVi: một cảm giác đau khổ, nhút nhát hoặc tội lỗi do một tình huống không thoải mái

examples: This is one of our top cultural projects, for which we are putting our shoulders to the wheel with great enthusiasm.
Olivia's enthusiasm and passion for environmental causes make her the young blood that inspires others to take action.
The musician continued to perform and compose music despite their age, believing that age may wrinkle the face, but lack of enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
So, enthusiasm was up.
They enjoyed our honesty, enthusiasm for the animals and passion for education.
words.defineEn: a feeling of great excitement and passion
words.defineVi: một cảm giác vô cùng phấn khích và đam mê

examples: James hits the panic button before you expect him to do so.
When the ship started sinking, the passengers panicked and it was every man for himself and the devil take the hindmost.
I made it to the alarm panel, and then I hit the panic button.
It was under my control until John pressed the panic button and told on us.
As a parent, I knew that there was a thin line between panic and caution.
words.defineEn: a feeling of extreme fear and anxiety that makes one unable to think clearly
words.defineVi: một cảm giác sợ hãi và lo lắng tột độ khiến người ta không thể suy nghĩ rõ ràng

examples: The old couple took pity on him and gave him food.
For pity's sake, help me!
I took pity on the stray cat and fed him.
We took pity on a couple of people waiting in the rain for a bus and gave them a lift.
The woman's heart was filled with pity for the orphaned children, and as she spent time with them, she realized that pity is akin to love, and she became devoted to them.
words.defineEn: a feeling of sadness caused by the suffering of others
words.defineVi: một cảm giác buồn bã gây ra bởi sự đau khổ của người khác

examples: Morning brought no relief from the heat.
He felt a sense of relief when the doctor assured him that his stomach issue was temporary.
He applied a few drops of spikenard oil to his temples, finding relief from his headache.
During the dog days of summer, the temperatures soar, and people seek relief by staying indoors or swimming in pools.
Even though I love traveling and seeing new places, I always feel a sense of relief when I return to my own house.
words.defineEn: a feeling of comfort that comes when something annoying or upsetting is gone
words.defineVi: một cảm giác thoải mái đến khi một cái gì đó gây phiền nhiễu hoặc khó chịu đã biến mất

examples: The daredevil performer, Max, shocked the audience by performing his entire circus act in his birthday suit.
Jessica's parents were shocked when they discovered she swings both ways.
After the initial shock, Lisa got a grip on herself and called an ambulance.
I have to admit that the news gave us a shock.
The shock of the announcement make me go weak at the knees.
words.defineEn: the feeling of strong surprise caused by something unexpected and often unpleasant
words.defineVi: cảm giác ngạc nhiên mạnh mẽ gây ra bởi một cái gì đó bất ngờ và thường khó chịu

examples: Under stress, the body produces adrenalin.
If you keep working so hard, the stress will eventually take its toll.
The stress of the job caused him to fall to pieces and have panic attacks.

Michael stressed over the prospect of finding a new school for his autistic son yet again after two moves in three years, knowing that three moves are as bad as a fire for his son's specialized educational needs.
What is stressed rather is that the same phenomenon provides the foundation for both historical tendencies.
words.defineEn: a feeling of anxiety and worry caused by different life problems
words.defineVi: một cảm giác lo lắng và lo lắng gây ra bởi các vấn đề cuộc sống khác nhau

examples: I stood rooted to the spot with terror.

That doesn’t exactly inspire terror.
Stories like this one from The Scottish antiquary, or, Northern notes and queries in 1891 speak to his terror of freshwater and the Nuckelavee’s grotesque appearance.
And this included the terror birds.
words.defineEn: a feeling of great fear
words.defineVi: một cảm giác sợ hãi lớn

examples: The fast roller coaster thrilled riders with its speed.
Millions tune in to watch the thrills and spills of stock car racing.
The athlete knew that every light has its shadow, and that the thrill of victory was often accompanied by the fear of defeat.
Getting involved in a toxic relationship may provide the thrill of drama and excitement, but it can also lead to emotional abuse, manipulation, and heartbreak.
He was always a rather reserved person, so it shocked me to learn that he was so into the thrills and chills of white-water rafting.
words.defineEn: a sudden feeling of pleasure and excitement
words.defineVi: một cảm giác vui vẻ và phấn khích bất ngờ

examples: The conflict has now reached a new level of intensity.
To bring an end to the conflict.
There is often a conflict of interests between farmers and conservationists.
The conflict in this story was shown when the cyclops grabbed some of Odysseus' men and bashed their brains out on the floor.
The talks are aimed at ending the conflict.
words.defineEn: a situation in which one is frustrated because of experiencing opposing desires or feelings at the same time

examples: Wonders never cease!
Wonders never cease!
Will wonders ever cease?
Would wonders ever cease?
Would wonders never cease?!
words.defineEn: a feeling of admiration or surprise caused by something that is very unusual and exciting
words.defineVi: một cảm giác ngưỡng mộ hoặc ngạc nhiên gây ra bởi một cái gì đó là rất bất thường và thú vị

examples: Don't worry.

Don’t worry.
Don't worry about it.
Don't worry about him.

examples: She felt drunk with rage.

The book is "Rage."
words.defineEn: great anger that is hard to contain
